channel.title: rediff News
channel.description: India's largest news and entertainment service online.

item.title: Kejriwal sounds poll bugle in Punjab, says I don't fear Badals
item.description: Hitting out at the Badals, the ruling family of Punjab, the Delhi chief minister said that once his party comes to power, it will launch a commission of inquiry against the family to investigate their 'misrule' in last ten years and send them behind bars.

item.title: Kai Po Che! International kite festival takes off with flying colours
item.description: The festival begins on Uttarayana, the day when winter starts turning into summer, and will conclude on Makar Sankranti.

item.title: Foreign Secretary-level talks deferred; India agrees to Pak SIT visit
item.description: India and Pakistan on Thursday deferred their foreign secretary-level talks to "very near future" even as government here welcomed the apprehending of Jaish-e- Mohammad members linked to the Pathankot terror attack and agreed to the visit of a Pakistani SIT.

item.title: 'Mamata must restore confidence of Hindus in Kaliachak'
item.description: 'People are tense. The morale of the perpetrators of the Kaliachak attack is very high.'

item.title: 'Jacko, your reward will be in heaven'
item.description: Tarun Vijay, MP, salutes the General whom he adored as a great friend.

item.title: Sydney Opera House evacuated after bomb threat
item.description: All tours of the Opera House were also cancelled for the day and ferries were either delayed or cancelled.

item.title: Sikh bus driver in Los Angeles assaulted, branded terrorist
item.description: A Sikh bus driver in Los Angeles was brutally assaulted and called a terrorist and a suicide bomber, the victim's representatives said on Wednesday.

item.title: SC terms petition against odd-even scheme 'publicity stunt'
item.description: The Supreme Court, however, said it will ask authorities like Delhi Metro Rail Corporation to augment public transport system to ensure people do not face difficulty.

item.title: 3 students into custody in connection to Pathankot attack
item.description: Three students were on Wednesday taken into custody in Pakistan in connection with the Pathankot attack.

item.title: SC refuses to cancel odd-even rule: SC
item.description: Terming the plea as a 'publicity stunt', the Supreme Court said, "People are dying due to pollution. We are doing car-pooling and you want to challenge it."
